tutorial.title: Photo Album
tutorial.descriptionContent: Create a simple photo album using a DOM tree and DOM manipulation

executableContent.instructions:
In this project, we'll work on creating a web page for an online photo album.

This is the image we will build the web page from.

![html tree]( https://mimo.app/i/project_tree.png)

Let's look at what we will start off with. 

- There is an `index.html` file with some starting code.
- There are  `script` tags with some code within them that we will use later on.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
<!doctype html>
<html>
  <body>
    <script>
      const ul = document.getElementById("keywords");
      const main = document.getElementById("photo");
      
      function goPrevious() {}
      
      function goNext() {}
    </script>
  </body>
</html>

executableContent.instructions:
![html tree]( https://mimo.app/i/project_tree.png)

1. Create the elements on the left side of the tree starting at the `head` node down to the text node.
2. Use whatever text you deem appropriate for the page title.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
<!doctype html>
<html>
  <body>
    <script>
      const ul = document.getElementById("keywords");
      const main = document.getElementById("photo");
      
      function goPrevious() {}
      
      function goNext() {}
    </script>
  </body>
</html>
files.solvedContent:
<!doctype html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>A Title</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <script>
      const ul = document.getElementById("keywords");
      const main = document.getElementById("photo");
      
      function goPrevious() {}
      
      function goNext() {}
    </script>
  </body>
</html>

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Remember to create the `head` element and then the `title` element inside it.

executableContent.instructions:
![html tree]( https://mimo.app/i/project_tree.png)

1. Create the elements in the right part of the tree starting from the `body` down to the `nav` and its children `buttons`.
2. Add the text "Previous" and "Next".

files.name: index.html
files.content:
<!doctype html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>A Title</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <script>
      const ul = document.getElementById("keywords");
      const main = document.getElementById("photo");
      
      function goPrevious() {}
      
      function goNext() {}
    </script>
  </body>
</html>
files.solvedContent:
<!doctype html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>A Title</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <nav>
      <button>Previous</button>
      <button>Next</button>
    </nav>
    <script>
      const ul = document.getElementById("keywords");
      const main = document.getElementById("photo");
      
      function goPrevious() {}
      
      function goNext() {}
    </script>
  </body>
</html>

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Add a `nav` element inside the `body` element.  Add two `button` elements inside of the `nav` element,

executableContent.instructions:
![html tree]( https://mimo.app/i/project_tree.png)

1. Create the part of the tree starting from the `body` down to `h1` and `img`.
2. Assign the `src` attribute of `img` to `https://mimo.app/i/beach.png`.
3. Add the `alt` attribute to the `img` element. Add the text `Beach` to it.
4. Add the `width` attribute to the `img` element. Make sure it is set to `"200"`.
5. Assign an appropriate text node as the child of the `h1`. This text will be the title of your picture.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
<!doctype html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>A Title</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <nav>
      <button>Previous</button>
      <button>Next</button>
    </nav>
    <script>
      const ul = document.getElementById("keywords");
      const main = document.getElementById("photo");
      
      function goPrevious() {}
      
      function goNext() {}
    </script>
  </body>
</html>
files.solvedContent: Vacation

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Remember to add a `main` element directly after the `nav` element. Add a `h1` and `img` element inside the `main` element.

executableContent.instructions:
![html tree]( https://mimo.app/i/project_tree.png)

1. Code the part of the tree starting from the `ul` down to `li`.
2. Add some keywords describing the image as the children text of the `li` elements.

files.name: index.html
files.content: Vacation
files.solvedContent:
Vacation

  • beach
  • ocean

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Remember to add a `ul` element directly after the `img` element. Add two `li` elements inside the `ul` element.

executableContent.instructions:
Now that we have our html tree complete, let's add the appropriate button function calls to add interactivity.

Attach `onclick` event listeners to each button to appropriately call the `goNext()` and `goPrevious()` functions.

1. Add an `onclick` event listener to the `Previous` button that calls the `goPrevious()` function. 
2. Add an `onclick` event listener to the `Next` button that calls the `goNext()` function.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Vacation

  • beach
  • ocean
files.solvedContent:
Vacation

  • beach
  • ocean

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Remember, to add an event listener to an HTML element, we write `onclick="func_name()"` to the button element. Change `func_name` accordingly.

executableContent.instructions:
We now need to give our elements some IDs so we can refer to them in our code.

1. Add an ID of `"photo"` to the `main` element . 
2. Add an ID of `"keywords"` to the `ul` element .

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Vacation

  • beach
  • ocean
files.solvedContent:
Vacation

  • beach
  • ocean

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
Remember, to add an `id` to an element,  we write `id="specific_name"` as an attribute.

Change "specific_name" accordingly.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's now add the functionality of cycling through the photo album. 

We have the `goPrevious` function which will change the photo when the `Previous` button is clicked. 

We have the `goNext` function which will change the photo when the `Next` button is clicked. 

1. In the `goPrevious` and `goNext` functions, assign the text of the first child of `main` to a title like `Vacation` or `Rome`.
2. In the `goPrevious` and `goNext` functions, assign the `src` of the second child of `main` to a URL.

Use any of the following URLs to assign the `src` attribute:

```
https://mimo.app/i/beach.png
https://mimo.app/i/colosseum.png
https://mimo.app/i/eiffel.png
https://mimo.app/i/greece.png
```

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Vacation

  • beach
  • ocean
files.solvedContent:
Vacation

  • beach
  • ocean

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
Your code should be structured like this:

```Javascript
   main.children[0].innerHTML = "Vacation"
   main.children[1].src = "https://mimo.app/i/beach.png"
 
```

executableContent.instructions:
We now want to populate the `li` elements with some keywords for each photo. Code the following in the  `onPrevious` and `onNext` functions.

1. Assign the text of the first child of `ul` to a descriptive keyword, like `beach` or `colosseum`.
2. Assign the text of the second child of `ul` to a descriptive keyword.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Vacation

  • beach
  • ocean
files.solvedContent:
Vacation

  • beach
  • ocean

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
Your code should be structured like this:

```Javascript
        ul.children[0].innerHTML = "beach"
        ul.children[1].innerHTML = "ocean"
 
```
